init.create_cluster_description: Create a new cluster and promote this node as leader
init.join_cluster_description: Add this node to an existing cluster
init.change_admin_password_description: This is needed for security reasons
init.vpn_endpoint_address_tooltip: Worker nodes use this address to connect to the leader. Ensure it is correctly resolved and reachable by worker nodes
init.vpn_endpoint_port_tooltip: Worker nodes use this port number to connect to the leader. It can differ from the WireGuard listening port 55820. Change this port number only if there is a port-forwarding appliance between the workers and the leader
init.vpn_cidr_tooltip: This is the VPN network used by cluster nodes to communicate. Ensure this network does not conflict with existing ones. Note that VPN network cannot be changed later
init.join_code_helper_text: You can obtain join code by accessing
init.redirect_cluster_description: This node is a worker of the cluster now. Click the button below to access cluster administration page on the leader node.
init.restore_cluster_description: Restore cluster and apps from backup
init.backup_password_tooltip: Encryption password used to cyper the backup.
init.invalid_passphrase: Invalid password. Enter the password used to encrypt cluster backup.
init.skip_apps_restore_1: Do you want to skip apps restore?
init.skip_apps_restore_2: You can restore apps later in Backup page
init.review_node_fqdn_description: Set the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of this cluster node

app_drawer.no_apps_description: To install apps go to Software center

hint.notifications: You can find notifications and progress of tasks here
hint.copy_to_clipboard: Click here to copy to clipboard

notification.no_notifications_description: You don't have any recent notifications yet

backup.title: Backup
backup.empty_state_repository_description: Add a repository to configure backup
backup.delete_repo_explanation_1: Any scheduled backup using this repository will be deleted too, but your backed up data will be left intact on the original repository. This action is NOT reversible.
backup.delete_repo_explanation_2: Ensure you have stored repository password in a safe place, or you won't be able to restore your backup data from the original repository.
backup.type_repo_password_to_confirm: Type repository password to confirm deletion
backup.repository_name_helper: An easy to remember name for the repository
backup.genericS3_url_tooltip: Enter an address with format server_fqdn/bucket_name. Note: the server must have a valid TLS certificate
backup.backup_repository_exists: A repository with this URL already exists
backup.cluster_configuration_info: Additionally, the cluster configuration is automatically backed up to a repository during each scheduled run.
backup.backup_name_helper: An easy to remember name for the backup
backup.delete_backup_explanation_1: {instanceName} won't be backed up anymore. If you change your mind, you'll have to schedule a new backup. | {numInstances} app instances won't be backed up anymore. If you change your mind, you'll have to schedule a new backup.
backup.delete_backup_explanation_2: Existing backed up data will be left intact on the original repository.
backup.name: Name
backup.app_instances_not_backed_up_description: {numInstances} app instance has no backup configured | {numInstances} app instances have no backup configured
backup.disabled_backups_description: There is {num} backup disabled | There are {num} backups disabled
backup.repository_password_helper: Enter password if repository was configured previously
backup.not_backed_up_instances_selected: Instances not backed up are currently selected
backup.repo_password_tooltip: This password is used to encrypt data in the repository. Store this password in a safe place, otherwise you won't be able to restore your backed up data
backup.minutes_past_the_hour: Every hour, {minutes} minute past the hour | Every hour, {minutes} minutes past the hour
backup.retention_tooltip: Number of backup snapshots stored before automatic deletion
backup.select_restore_node: Select the node where the instance will be restored
backup.no_instance_to_restore_description: It looks like there is no app instance backed up on your repositories
backup.backup_page_tooltip_1: Here you can configure your backups and restore any app.
backup.backup_page_tooltip_2: Cluster data is composed of cluster configuration data and apps data.
backup.apps_configuration_tooltip: Add your backup repositories and configure apps backup scheduling
backup.restore_tooltip: You can restore any previously backed up app or the whole cluster:
backup.backup_page_tooltip_8: Disaster recovery: you will need a cluster configuration backup and a fresh installation of {productName}. The disaster recovery can be achieved only from the cluster configuration wizard.
backup.backup_page_tooltip_manual: For more information go to the Backup and restore manual page.
backup.repositories_tooltip: These are the repositories where your apps are backed up to
backup.cluster_configuration_tooltip: Download an encrypted GPG file that you can use to restore the cluster in a disaster recovery scenario. Additionally, the cluster configuration is automatically backed up to a repository during each scheduled run.
backup.cluster_backup_password_info_description:
Enter a password to encrypt the backup.
For security reasons do not use your current password.
Make sure to remember it, you will need it in case of disaster recovery.
backup.i_have_stored_encryption_password: I have stored the password in a safe place
backup.cluster_backup_password_warning: You must set the encryption password
backup.cluster_backup_password_warning_descript: The configuration cluster backup contains sensitive data required for a disaster recovery.
Set a strong encryption password, then download the backup and keep it in a safe place.
backup.smb_url_tooltip: It is possible to specify a share subfolder path using the "/" slash separator
backup.samba_tooltips: Only shares with SMB2/3 protocols are supported. Deprecated SMB1/CIFS shares are not secure and cannot be accessed.
backup.cluster_placeholder: Choose a node in the cluster

settings_subscription.cluster_subscription_description: Log in to {enterprise} or {subscription} to manage the subscription

settings_http_routes.title: HTTP routes
settings_http_routes.name: Name
settings_http_routes.strip_prefix_tooltip: Traefik prefixes option defines the prefixes to strip from the request URL. E.g.: It allows you to strip a specified prefix from the URL path. If, for example, you remove /api from /api/v1/resource, the resulting path after it is applied would be /v1/resource.
settings_http_routes.url_tooltip: An example of valid URL is: http://127.0.0.1:2000
settings_http_routes.host_tooltip: An example of valid host is: myapp.example.org
settings_http_routes.path_tooltip: Path must start with a slash character "/". Matching evaluation will be performed with and without the trailing slash. E.g. /foo will match /foo and /foo/*
settings_http_routes.delete_route_description: Delete route {name}? Any application associated with this route won't be accessible anymore.
settings_http_routes.path_must_start_with_slash: Path must start with a slash character "/"
settings_http_routes.host_is_not_valid_not_localhost: 'localhost' or '127.0.0.1' can be used only if you specify a path
settings_http_routes.node_helper: Select the node where the route will be created
settings_http_routes.skipCertVerify_tooltip: Skip certificate validation for the backend target URL

settings_tls_certificates.no_tls_certificate_description: There is no TLS certificate requested
settings_tls_certificates.cert_upload_helptext: Chain of certificates must be in the same file.
settings_tls_certificates.instance_selection_label: Select instance to upload the file to.
settings_tls_certificates.certificate_tls_tooltips: The certificate is required by a HTTP route

settings_account.title: Account
settings_account.2fa_description: Two-factor authentication adds an additional layer of security to your account by requiring a verification code to sign in.
settings_account.qr_code_description: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app to configure 2FA authentication on your mobile device.
settings_account.qr_code_description_tooltip: You can use any 2FA app, such as Google Authenticator, Authy or FreeOTP
settings_account.store_setup_key_description: First of all, store 2FA setup key in a safe place. You'll need it if you try to log in and your authenticator app is not configured (e.g. you just bought a new phone). Don't share it, it's a password
settings_account.store_setup_key_suggestion: Have you already stored 2FA setup key in a safe place?
settings_account.i_have_stored_setup_key: I have stored 2FA setup key in a safe place
settings_account.confirm_revoke_2fa: Do you really want to revoke two-factor authentication?

domains.title: Domains and users
domains.empty_state_domains_description: Create a domain to configure users and groups
domains.internal_description: Install an account provider on a cluster node
domains.external_description: Bind to an existent account provider
domains.choose_node_for_account_provider_install: Choose node for account provider installation
domains.delete_internal_domain_confirm: Delete internal domain {name}? All users, groups and account provider data will be deleted. This action is NOT reversible
domains.delete_external_domain_confirm: Delete external domain {name}? Account provider data will be left intact, but if you change your mind you'll have to bind the external domain again
domains.unconfigured_domains_or_providers_title: There are unconfigured domains or providers
domains.unconfigured_domains_or_providers_descri: You can resume their configuration or delete them
domains.ipaddress_bind_check_failed: Cannot bind to one or more TCP ports
domains.domain_is_going_to_be_deleted: Domain {object} is going to be deleted...
domains.cannot_connect_to_domain_controller_desc: Try to route IP traffic of domain controllers through cluster VPN
domains.wrong_service_port_or_tls_setting: Wrong service port or TLS settings
domains.ipaddress_dc_conflict_check_failed: A provider with this IP already exists
domains.domain_pattern: Invalid domain pattern. Enter something like 'my.domain.org'
domains.enable_the_password_expiration: The minimum password age setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password must be used before the user can change it. The maximum password age setting determines the period of time (in days) that a password can be used before the system requires the user to change it
domains.enable_the_policy_strength_tips: If enabled, users must comply with some minimal password requirements
domains.enable_complexity_check_tips: Enforce complexity by requesting uppercase, lowercase, numbers and symbols
domains.users_admin_page_tooltips: User portal permits domain users to change their own password. The portal is accessible to users also on any node running the domain provider replica. The generic URL is https://{node_fqdn_or_ip}/users-admin/{domain}/
domains.host_format: Must be a valid domain name or IP address

samba.samba_admin_username_tooltip_1: If you choose a username other than administrator:
samba.samba_admin_username_tooltip_2: The specified user will be added to Domain Admins group
samba.samba_admin_username_tooltip_3: administrator user will be disabled and a random password will be set to it
samba.choose_samba_admin_password: Choose a password for Samba admin user
samba.enable_file_server_label: Provide file shares and authentication to Windows clients
samba.enable_file_server_tooltip: Enable this switch and select the desired IP address to provide Active Directory services to clients in the local private network
samba.enable_file_server_disabled_info: File shares and authentication to Windows clients cannot be enabled because they are already configured on another provider of this domain
samba.provider_on_vpn_address_message: The new provider will be configured on the VPN IP address {vpnIpAddress}
samba.choose_ip_address_warning: Make sure to select an IP address reachable by Windows clients. This choice is NOT reversible

domain_users.cannot_make_changes_to_an_external_domai: Cannot make changes to an external domain

nodes.title: Nodes
nodes.add_node_to_cluster_step_2: Copy the join code in the box below
nodes.cpu_load_tooltip: CPU average load of last 1 / 5 / 15 minutes
nodes.node_label_tooltip: You can assign the node an easy to remember name
nodes.nodes_offline_c: {num} node is offline | {num} nodes are offline
nodes.nodes_offline_description_c: Check node status and connectivity | Check nodes status and connectivity
nodes.remove_node_confirm: Remove {name} from the cluster? This action is NOT reversible
nodes.validation_node_in_use: The node cannot be removed because the following app is installed on it: {apps} | The node cannot be removed because the following apps are installed on it: {apps}
nodes.remove_node_apps_confirm:
The following app is installed on {node}: {nodeApps}.
If you remove this node, {nodeApps} will be removed too. | The following apps are installed on {node}: {nodeApps}.
If you remove this node, these apps will be removed too.
nodes.promote_node_confirm: {name} will be promoted to leader role.
nodes.node_vpn_endpoint_address_tooltip: Worker nodes use this address to connect to the leader. Ensure it is correctly resolved and reachable by worker nodes
nodes.node_vpn_endpoint_port_tooltip: Worker nodes use this port number to connect to the leader. It can differ from the WireGuard listening port 55820. Change this port number only if there is a port-forwarding appliance between the workers and the leader
nodes.reset_backup_encryption_password_info: After node promotion, go to Backup section and setup the backup encryption password
nodes.new_cluster_admin_message:
From now on, cluster administration will be available at:
https://{endpointAddress}/cluster-admin/
nodes.validation_endpoint_address_not_reachabl: VPN endpoint address is not reachable, please check it again. If you know what you are doing and want to skip this check, uncheck Check node connectivity and try again
nodes.shutdown_node_after_removal: Shut down {node} after node removal to stop the apps running on it

smarthost.title: Email notifications
smarthost.enabled: Send notifications with an SMTP server
smarthost.connection_timeout_error: The connection issued a timeout error, verify the SMTP port number and the SMTP server name
smarthost.cannot_authenticate_to_server: The server refuses the connection, it is probably due to a bad login or bad password
smarthost.cannot_connect_to_server: The server refuses the connection, please try again.
smarthost.connection_not_supported_by_server: The connection is not supported by the server, you should try to enable STARTTLS
smarthost.valid_certificate_verification_error: The certificate is not valid for the server, you should try to disable the certificate verification
smarthost.port_invalid_type: It must be a valid number port (1-65535)
smarthost.port_number_gte: The port must be greater than 0 (1-65535)
smarthost.encrypt_smtp_enum: It must be one of the following: none, starttls, tls
